title: How to Charge Your Cell Phone

steps.title: Find a charger that fits your cell phone.
steps.content: Find a charger that fits your cell phone. They usually come with the phone. If you have lost yours, see if you have another one that works with your phone or go to the place you bought the phone and see about getting a new one. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Check the battery on your phone.
steps.content: Check the battery on your phone. If it's four or three bars, you don't need to charge it. But once it is down to two, one, or even no bars of power, it needs to be charged. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Plug your charger into an outlet and slid the smaller part into your phone.
steps.content: Plug your charger into an outlet and slid the smaller part into your phone. Do not just shove it in, as this could damage the phone.

steps.title: If your phone doesn't beep or pop up with a message, check the battery.
steps.content: If your phone doesn't beep or pop up with a message, check the battery. It should be flashing if your phone is charging or a different color. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Leave your phone to charge for a few hours.
steps.content: Leave your phone to charge for a few hours.
